## Steps to reproduce

```powershell
[CmdletBinding()]
Param(
  [Parameter(ValueFromPipeline, Mandatory)]
  [Int] $Param
)

Process {
  Write-Host "Parameter: $Param"
}
```

1. Invoke the script with ```1 | ./test.ps1```.
2. Invoke the script with ```1 | pwsh -NoProfile -ExecutionPolicy Unrestricted -Command ./test.ps1```.

## Expected behavior

```none
Both invocations emit a single output string.
```

## Actual behavior

```powershell
PS C:\Temp> 1 | ./test.ps1

Parameter: 1
PS C:\Temp> 1 | pwsh -NoProfile -ExecutionPolicy Unrestricted -Command ./test.ps1


cmdlet test.ps1 at command pipeline position 1
Supply values for the following parameters:   
Param: 1
Parameter: 1
PS C:\Temp>
```

comments.author: chscott
comments.body:
Looks like it is this issue: https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/issues/9497. I can work around it using the $Input trick.

```powershell
PS C:\Temp> 1 | pwsh -NoProfile -ExecutionPolicy Unrestricted -NonInteractive -Command '$Input | ./test.ps1'

Parameter: 1
```

title: Invoking pwsh with input from pipeline produces prompt for data that is already provided
